meanings.definition: A deposit, usually of calcium carbonate, shaped like an upward-pointing icicle, hanging from the roof of a cave or the like, and formed by the dripping of percolating calcareous water.
meanings.sent1: The stalagmites in the cave looked like frozen spikes pointing upwards.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to touch the stalagmites in the cave; they are fragile formations.
meanings.sent3: The stalagmites in the cave seemed to be reaching out for a high-five.
meanings.sent4: The stalagmites in the cave stood tall like ancient guardians of the underground realm.
meanings.sent5: The guide warned us to watch our heads to avoid bumping into the stalagmites.

meanings.definition: A similar deposit on the floor of a cave formed by the dripping of calcareous water.
meanings.sent1: We marveled at the stalagmites rising from the cave floor like miniature mountains.
meanings.sent2: The flashlight illuminated the stalagmites on the cave floor, creating eerie shadows.
meanings.sent3: The stalagmites on the cave floor looked like a forest of stone trees.
meanings.sent4: The stalagmites on the cave floor seemed to be frozen waves of stone.
meanings.sent5: The tour guide pointed out the unique shapes of the stalagmites on the cave floor.
